channel.title: walt whitman on Khaled Allen

item.title: The Costs of Success
item.description:
[caption id="attachment_1502" align="alignright" width="300" caption="` TheDreamSky on Flickr"][/caption]

"I too am not a bit tamedâ€”I too am untranslatable;

I sound my barbaric yawp over the roofs of the world." -Walt Whitman

 

YAWP!

YAWP!!!!

YAWP!!!!!!!!!


YAAAAAWWWWP!!!!!!!!!!

My girlfriend had me screaming this at the top of my lungs in the middle of a local park, as a exercise in letting myself be heard. After my yell (there was only one) I cringed, waiting for something bad to happen, as if I'd broken some rule by being loud.

I discovered that I am kind of scared of being noticed, which is sort of a problem if I'm trying to be a world famous author who writes insightful and controversial works on the nature of the human spirit. Presumably, if I do that well, I'd be noticed.

Then, in classic over-analytical fashion, it occured to me that I might be tamping down my excellent writing in order not to be noticed. My subconscious (insidious little bugger) knew that if I wrote all the earth-shattering and poignant things I wanted to write, people would in fact start to notice, and then all my YAWPing would put me in the spotlight.

Well, now I've figured out what my subconcious has been up to behind my back...NO MORE!
